result.markdown:
---
title: "Arrange"
---


The `dplyr::arrange()` function allows you to arrange the rows of a __tibble__.

## Dataset

For demostration we'll load and subset the `knz_bison` data from the [lterdatasampler package](/datasets/lterdatasampler.qmd) (hyperlink includes install instructions).


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
#Load package
library("lterdatasampler")
#Subset of knz_bison tibble for demonstration
bison_tbl <- tibble::as_tibble(lterdatasampler::knz_bison)[c(5,4,3,2,1,6,7,8,9,10)*100,]
bison_tbl
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
# A tibble: 10 × 8
   data_code rec_year rec_month rec_day animal_code animal_sex animal_weight
   <chr>        <dbl>     <dbl>   <dbl> <chr>       <chr>              <dbl>
 1 CBH01         1997        10      31 B-802       F                   1050
 2 CBH01         1996        10      25 W-513       F                    532
 3 CBH01         1996        10      25 B-701       F                   1002
 4 CBH01         1995        11       6 90X         M                   1408
 5 CBH01         1994        11       8 OR 6        F                    486
 6 CBH01         1997        10      31 W-725       F                    256
 7 CBH01         1998        11      13 W-513       F                    924
 8 CBH01         1998        11      13 W-743       F                    604
 9 CBH01         1999        11       5 B-403       F                   1092
10 CBH01         1999        11       5 W-763       F                    758
# ℹ 1 more variable: animal_yob <dbl>
```
:::
:::


## Numeric columns

Arrange the __tibble__ by rec_year:


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
dplyr::arrange(bison_tbl, rec_year)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
# A tibble: 10 × 8
   data_code rec_year rec_month rec_day animal_code animal_sex animal_weight
   <chr>        <dbl>     <dbl>   <dbl> <chr>       <chr>              <dbl>
 1 CBH01         1994        11       8 OR 6        F                    486
 2 CBH01         1995        11       6 90X         M                   1408
 3 CBH01         1996        10      25 W-513       F                    532
 4 CBH01         1996        10      25 B-701       F                   1002
 5 CBH01         1997        10      31 B-802       F                   1050
 6 CBH01         1997        10      31 W-725       F                    256
 7 CBH01         1998        11      13 W-513       F                    924
 8 CBH01         1998        11      13 W-743       F                    604
 9 CBH01         1999        11       5 B-403       F                   1092
10 CBH01         1999        11       5 W-763       F                    758
# ℹ 1 more variable: animal_yob <dbl>
```
:::
:::


`dplyr::arrange()` will arrange the rows by the selected column in ascending fashion (lowest to highest). You can use the `desc()` function on columns you wan't to be orded in descing fashion.

Arrange the __tibble__ by rec_year in descending fashion:


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
dplyr::arrange(bison_tbl, desc(rec_year))
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
# A tibble: 10 × 8
   data_code rec_year rec_month rec_day animal_code animal_sex animal_weight
   <chr>        <dbl>     <dbl>   <dbl> <chr>       <chr>              <dbl>
 1 CBH01         1999        11       5 B-403       F                   1092
 2 CBH01         1999        11       5 W-763       F                    758
 3 CBH01         1998        11      13 W-513       F                    924
 4 CBH01         1998        11      13 W-743       F                    604
 5 CBH01         1997        10      31 B-802       F                   1050
 6 CBH01         1997        10      31 W-725       F                    256
 7 CBH01         1996        10      25 W-513       F                    532
 8 CBH01         1996        10      25 B-701       F                   1002
 9 CBH01         1995        11       6 90X         M                   1408
10 CBH01         1994        11       8 OR 6        F                    486
# ℹ 1 more variable: animal_yob <dbl>
```
:::
:::


## String columns

Strings are order by alphabetical order.

Default is from A-Z (ascending).


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
dplyr::arrange(bison_tbl, animal_sex)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
# A tibble: 10 × 8
   data_code rec_year rec_month rec_day animal_code animal_sex animal_weight
   <chr>        <dbl>     <dbl>   <dbl> <chr>       <chr>              <dbl>
 1 CBH01         1997        10      31 B-802       F                   1050
 2 CBH01         1996        10      25 W-513       F                    532
 3 CBH01         1996        10      25 B-701       F                   1002
 4 CBH01         1994        11       8 OR 6        F                    486
 5 CBH01         1997        10      31 W-725       F                    256
 6 CBH01         1998        11      13 W-513       F                    924
 7 CBH01         1998        11      13 W-743       F                    604
 8 CBH01         1999        11       5 B-403       F                   1092
 9 CBH01         1999        11       5 W-763       F                    758
10 CBH01         1995        11       6 90X         M                   1408
# ℹ 1 more variable: animal_yob <dbl>
```
:::
:::


Set it to descing will order it from Z-A.


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
dplyr::arrange(bison_tbl, desc(animal_sex))
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
# A tibble: 10 × 8
   data_code rec_year rec_month rec_day animal_code animal_sex animal_weight
   <chr>        <dbl>     <dbl>   <dbl> <chr>       <chr>              <dbl>
 1 CBH01         1995        11       6 90X         M                   1408
 2 CBH01         1997        10      31 B-802       F                   1050
 3 CBH01         1996        10      25 W-513       F                    532
 4 CBH01         1996        10      25 B-701       F                   1002
 5 CBH01         1994        11       8 OR 6        F                    486
 6 CBH01         1997        10      31 W-725       F                    256
 7 CBH01         1998        11      13 W-513       F                    924
 8 CBH01         1998        11      13 W-743       F                    604
 9 CBH01         1999        11       5 B-403       F                   1092
10 CBH01         1999        11       5 W-763       F                    758
# ℹ 1 more variable: animal_yob <dbl>
```
:::
:::
